subject: Productivity
title: The Telegraph and Speed of Information
description: A fast breakdown of The Telegraph and Speed of Information for builders.

hook.text: Before the telegraph, news from London to New York took weeks by ship. After, it took minutes.

buildup.text: Samuel Morse sent the first telegraph message in 1844: What hath God wrought.

discovery.text: Instant communication let businesses coordinate across distances. Markets, logistics, and news transformed.

twist.text: The telegraph created the first information overload. Operators drowned in messages they couldn't process.

climax.text: Every communication revolution since ‚Äî phone, email, chat ‚Äî echoes the telegraph's promise and problems.

punchline.text: Speed of information changed before speed of thinking did.
